abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Supervisory
            Authority Project for Mauritius aims to establish a modern
            well-regulated financial services industry. There are four
            project components. The first assists in developing an
            overall framework for the financial Sector Commission
            (FSC)It also includes advice on the stages of the
            implementation process, including staff needs and structural
            issues. The second component finances the review of existing
            standards, policies, and procedures; the development of
            standards for market conduct and prudential regulations; the
            development of internal policies and procedures concerning
            risk management; and the review of long-range goals. The
            third component funds staff training and skills building.
            The fourth component assesses the information technlogy
            needs of the FSC, including any equipment that it may
            inherit from the existing agencies; and procures and
            installs suitable equipment.
